body:

replies.body: I support. Gut Irelia 2015. Toxic kit that makes you lose for being ahead.

Garen got nerfed because he is ridiculous in his current state.  He can just run up to you, hit E, and then ult you, even under a turret.  While Irelia is a problem as well, Garen needed and probably still needs more nerfs.  In my opinion, he really needs is a rework to give him some form of counterplay, but since he just got reworked, nerfs will have to do.  Also, Irelia is on the rework list, so things will hopefully be better then.  Unless it ends up like Ryze's, Tristana's, or Garen's reworks, in which case it will not help.

BTW on a slightly unrelated note, I'm fine with the Skarner and Darius reworks, and while I think Mordekaiser still needs some work and a new ultimate, his rework was a step in the right direction.  Except for the dragon ghost and the third Q strike.
you talk as if irelia cant just walk up to you, stun you, and shrek you

except she can. i'm not saying irelia is op, she's just frustrating to play against no doubt.

i was playing mid and helped my top laner kill the jungler, a full hp irelia comes in and bursts me down with only sheen + phage because I was stunned for so long. was so confused because I didn't think  i met the hp requirement, it's a horribly designed mechanic

Garen didnt get reworked! His kit was weakened and true damage was added to his ult... that is all... btw 99% of people who complain about Garen only do it because they think he is magically doing more damage to them then before the "rework"... well guess what! if he is kickin your ass all game then chances are pretty high you are not the Villain therefore he is not doing true damage! Oh and now even if you are kickin his ass then you are still not the Villain and he is still not doing true damage!!! OMG!!! I bet i blew your mind.... Idk how many times ive had to explain that his E could always crit or his ult damage wasnt changed or that his Q silence was nerfed or that his W use to have tenacity and helluva lot more bonus resistances...  

**Edit**: on a side note garen is a fighter first and a tank second, so he is actually doing exactly as intended.

Except, Garen truly IS dealing more damage and on a MUCH MUCH more ridiculous scale than before. I don't enjoy playing a tank, getting bumrushed by Garen 2-3 times (Hey lol, low CD and no ressource, fun fun fun) and then ulted for 1.4k when I'm at 3.1k max HP. He's a fighter, not a "LOL YOU'RE DEAD IF EVER HIT 40% HP" type of guy. Assassins should have that type of ability, not a freaking "Juggernaut".

Only if you are the Villain... And Garen is doing better now then before because of the new juggernaut items. He synergizes too well with them but that can be said about a lot of champions, i mean Vayne and BotRK is fucking ridiculous... Fiora, Xin, Ekko, Fizz, Lee, Irelia, Jax, Yi, Nidalee, Pantheon, Riven, Vi, and Yasuo are all Fighters that can and often do instantly pop someone...

It's true , almost any "fighter/ assassin" can pop someone Fast as hell, and lower elo people sure they are going to get upset and come cry on the forums about it. But Garen being able to turret dive, take Multiple turret shots, Spin for true damage and then ult someone under tower completely 100-0 them. Wether it is the ADC or the Tank. Then he can Q out with a quick sprint just as good as the summoner ability "Ghost" and Instantly start regening huge portions of his health, so that he doesn't even have to back after such a greedy decision.

Is that no different than he was before the Juggernaut patch? Its fucking broken, maybe it was before too  but it is undeniable now. Except to Garen mains who want to push 2 buttons the whole game and still complain about things Garen does and the "nerfs".
He is an Automatic Champion. 
Fisher Price's My first champion. 
His ability rotation is no different than Katarina.. the difference is all the Armor, Health, Magic resist True damage, Health regen and escape.
That is the EXACT definition of Imbalance

Garen could always do that!!! Thats what im trying to say.... the only difference is you needed to build tanky. Btw Garen's Q gives him 30% MS for 1.5 seconds, Ghost gives 27% MS for 10 seconds and ignores unit collision... So its not really just as good, i mean if it gave the ability to ignore unit collision id say it was.  

Btw the more simple a champion is, the easier it is to deal with them. If you complain they are too simple then its because you don't know how to deal with them. The best way to deal with Garen is to not get hit by his Q, and you basically win the trade. If you are the Villain then run away, his Q has an 8 secod CD so if you can stop it (which you can easily with any form of CC) then you are pretty much home free unless he has Dead Man's Plate, but thats really a problem with that item now isnt it? Poking him to remove his passive during laning phase is how you bully him, if he cant regen then he will lose most trades. They lowered his silence duration and his E's damage early to mid game so he is a bit weaker ability-wise.   

Does Garen need nerfs? Yes his ult should not do true damage based off the targets missing health. His ult doesnt make sense anyways as it has nothing to do with Justice, its more like picking on the weak... but most of the issue is Garen's synergy with Dead Mans, Steraks, and Black Cleaver. But Garen is not OP he is a noob stomper, no one knows what to do and they panic when they see him coming. He is actually quite easy to shut down if you know what to do, and i have faced many a person who does.

Ghost has a Cool down of what, 4 minutes? What's the Cool down of Garen's Q again?... Does Ghost Silence, remove Slows and deal ALOT of damage too?
Also, no offense meant, but you can't just run away from Garen in middle of a teamfight. Do you even understand the implications of what that would do to your team if you're the tank? He's going to kill you within 6 seconds of the engage or you can wait until all your lanes are completely pushed. There's no way that the "Run away" excuse is actually legitimate. It's the same as saying "Well, Akali's coming she's 12-0, but it's okay, if she doesn't catch up to you she's not going to kill you, thus she's completely fine even if fed to hell." Doesn't work that way. When the only "counter play" to something is "Run the hell away" there's a **MAJOR** flaw somewhere.

{{champion:39}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3153}} 

Bad Irelia play isn't punished because of how strong her spike is with Trinity Force. I've regularly seen Irelias go 0/4 in lane, which is a death sentence for most top laners. E.X. they need to start building tanky, and being farm bots. How is it fair that every other top laner gets punished for how they preformed in top lane, but she does not? When she finishes Trinity she can get a double kill out of the blue.

This is on top of the fact that the laning phase for Irelia is not tough. She has built in tenacity, long duration stun that activates when when she has lower health percentage (this specifically leads to a lot of dumb moments when laning against her), gap closer, and heal. It's as if she was made for climbing in solo queue. Her power spike, which is huge, is at such a convenient time in ranked play. She doesn't have as many trade offs, and I don't believe she takes a lot of skill to use.

She does fall off late game, but the fall isn't as dramatic as her rise is, and her early game is not weak.

Since everyone is always complaining Riot releases skins before nerfs. I propose in celebration of the Irelia nerfs, they should create that "Better Nerf Irelia" skin that has been floating around in Skins and Champion Concepts. It's a good opportunity to make fun of that silly meme people still use today, even though she's been the queen of solo queue for this season. FOTMs have come and go, but she's still there. I am not. When she was released, Irelia caused all sorts of problems because she dominated top lane by having literally everything in her kit. It got to the point that Riven was specifically tailored upon release to be "strong enough to compete with Irelia in top lane." We all know how that turned out. Irelia was the bar that all other top laners were compared against, and it created a ridiculous arms race where each new champion had to be strong enough to compete with all the other champions strong enough to beat up on Irelia, namely Riven.

Remember, this was back when Heart of Gold and Philosopher's Stone were still auto buys on top laners. Renekton's lane bullying didn't matter because double gold per 5 items meant enemy tops could miss every CS and still scale to late game stronger than him.

All of this is getting off topic, though. The point is Irelia started a chain reaction by having a kit so perfectly suited to top lane that she pushed out basically everyone else, until she got pushed out in turn by new releases effectively designed to beat her.
